alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 9:23AM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast continue. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River at Taberville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 25.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Friday was 25.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.7 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.6 feet on 06/06/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 930 AM CDT.
